Key Arguments: The bill will degrade public trust in government and media rather than promote it.
The bill's authoritarian approach will decrease trust and foster disunity.
The exemption for government-authorized content is seen as hypocritical and unjust.
The proposal is likened to authoritarian regimes, suggesting it is unfit for a free country like Australia.
Notable Quotes: This bill will achieve the opposite effect of its intended purpose.
This is the kind of proposal that someone might expect under a Soviet-style regime. Not in Australia.
Such contempt for the Australian people the government is supposed to serve must be condemned.
